item.title: Investigators ask the South Korean MP to accuse the deposit leader
item.description: South Korea's anti-corruption office yesterday recommended to the Public Prosecutor's Office that deposed President Yoon Suk-yeol be charged with rebellion and abuse of power for declaring martial law in December. The Senior Officials Corruption Investigation Office (CIO) announced that it has transferred the case to the Public Prosecutor's Office, which has the power to formally charge a South Korean head of state. The CIO considers that Yoon conspired with the then Minister of National Defense, Kim Yong-hyun, and other military officers to start a mutiny, declaring martial law on the night of December 3rd. It further argues that Yoon abused his power by sending troops to the National Assembly (parliament) to prevent deputies from revoking martial law. The Public Prosecution Service now has 11 days to decide whether or not to start the requested process. If Yoon is considered guilty of leading an insurrection, a crime for which a president has no immunity in the country, he may be sentenced to life imprisonment or the death penalty. Yoon has been in pre-trial detention at the Seoul Detention Center, in Uiwang, south of Seoul, since January 15. The Constitutional Court is simultaneously holding a trial to determine whether or not to ratify the dismissal approved by parliamentarians on December 14th. If the highest court in South Korea confirms the impeachment, early presidential elections have to be called within 60 days after the court decision. Yoon refuses to witness in the investigation into the alleged crime of rebellion. Yoon Suk-Youol surprised the country on December 3 by declaring martial law, a measure reminiscent of black days of the South Korean military dictatorship and that justified with the intention of protecting the country from “North Korean Communist forces” and “Eliminate elements hostile to the state”. Pressured by the deputies and thousands of protesters, Yoon was forced to revoke the decision hours later.

item.title: Competitions | Deputies discussed “competitive negotiation”
item.description: The possibility of Public Administration representatives directly negotiating public tender proposals with candidates was discussed yesterday in the 1st Permanent Committee of the Legislative Assembly. This new feature will be created by the proposed public procurement law, generally approved on January 11th of last year. According to the explanations of Ella Law, chairman of the Commission, the possibility of the so -called “competitive negotiation” with candidates is a novelty of the law, but can only be used in three situations: when all public tender proposals are refused, although without amending Substantially the contest charges book, when the work is too complex, which makes it impracticable to establish a previous price for the proposals, or when the nature of the works make it impossible to set the prior fixation of a price. According to the newspaper Ou Mun, the proposed law establishes that when the Administration chooses to avoid public tendering, and requests proposals from a certain number of companies, the consultation must be carried out with at least five companies. However, Ella Lei indicated that deputies are concerned that the alleged “randomness” of the companies consulted is not guaranteed or results in a fair procedure, so this aspect will be discussed with the Executive.

item.title: Hospitality | More than 14.4 million guests in 2024
item.description:
Last year, Macau hotels hosted more than 14.4 million people, with the average room occupancy rate reaching 86.4 percent, an annual increase of almost 5 percent. Room prices in 5-star hotels rose 2.8 percent, with the average night stay standing at 1,585 patacas
The Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) yesterday revealed that last year the hotel establishments of Macau hosted about 14,433,000 people, totaling a 6.4 percent increase with 2023. Statistical data show a significant increase in international customers, which totaled more than 1.1 million, with annual growth of 57.4 percent. In this chapter, guests from the Republic of Korea are highlighted, which doubled annually, reaching 321 thousand. The number of guests from Malaysia (87,000), Japan (81,000), India (73,000) and Singapore (68,000) also rose by 53.4, 49.1, 97.2 and 24.1 percent, respectively. From a more operational perspective, in 2024 the industry registered an average occupancy rate of 86.4 percent guest rooms, plus 4.9 percentage points compared to 2023. The 5 -star hotels were the ones that recorded the highest occupancy rates Rooms (88.6 percent), with a rise of 6.1 percent. Sides of the medal During 2024, the average price of the five -star hotel rooms was 1,585 patacas, an increase of 2.8 percent compared to 2023, second data from the Macao Hotel Association, cited by the Tourism Services Directorate. The data reveal that last year's prices were only 0.6 percent below the 2019 registration The month of December exceeded the average prices practiced throughout 2024, with the average price in 4 and 5 star hotels reaching 1,624 patacas, yet a decrease of 8.1 percent compared to December 2023. Highlight for Last month that completed six consecutive months of homologous prices falls, a descent that began in July. At the end of last year there were 146 hotel establishments that provided public accommodation services (+4, compared to the end of the year 2023), providing a total of 43,000 rooms of guests (-7.8 percent).

item.title: Traffic | Accidents and fines shoot in 2024
item.description:
Last year ended with more than 15,500 road accidents, an annual increase of 14 percent. Despite the increase in injuries, which exceed 5,300, deaths on the road decreased to five. In 2024, authorities collected almost 190 million patacas in fines, an increase of 9.12 percent, despite infractions only rising 0.4 percent
More road accidents, more patacas in fines and less dead in road accidents. This can summarize 2024, according to the statistical data released by the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP). Last year, Macau's roads and streets recorded 15,510 road accidents, a total that represented an annual increase of 14.36 percent compared to 2023. Even so, 2024 was less deadly on the territory's roads, with five fatalities (all relating to drivers) compared to eight deaths recorded in 2023, i.e. a decrease of 37.5 percent. However, the number of injuries increased by almost 13 percent to a total of 5,341, climb driven by the increase of light injuries in a year when the wounds that needed hospitalization fell almost 50 percent. Still in the accident rate chapter, the highlight is the increase in accidents involving pedestrians, with an annual increase of 6.7 percent to a total of 510 occurrences. Economic diversification The year 2024 was also a period in which the value of fines added almost 16 million patacas compared to the previous year. Last year, the total value of fines was almost 189.8 million patacas, an increase of 9.12 percent compared to the same period last year. Despite the increase in the amount collected by the authorities, violations of the road traffic law and the highway code remained practically the same level, with a slight increase of 0.4 percent to 703.8 thousand occurrences. In the chapter of fines, the parking lot continued to dominate, with 618,260 fines, the very broad majority for illegal parking on public roads. Still, parking fines decreased by 2.38 percent compared to 2023. However, the number of blocked vehicles increased by 24.5 percent by 2024 for a total of 2,226. On the opposite side, data from 2024 from the CPSP reveal the return of a classic, with an increase of almost 48 percent in irregularities committed by taxi drivers to a total of 870 cases. In relation to drivers caught driving under the influence of alcohol, authorities counted 170 people drunk at the wheel, an annual increase of almost 7 percent. Of these 170 people, 155 were male. One of the statistics that has been increasing in recent times in the chapter of fines is the pedestrians that cross the road without complying with traffic rules. Last year, the authorities fined 7,460 pawns, totaling a 58.5 percent increase.

item.title: Lunar New Year | Decisive holidays to analyze expenses beyond game
item.description:
Professor at the University of Macau and tourism expert Glenn Mccartney considers that the holidays associated with Chinese New Year will be essential to understand the dimension of regional tourism and non-gambling related expenses
The lunar new year of the serpent starts next Wednesday and, once again, opens a period of holidays that will bring many tourists to Macao. According to the assistant professor at the University of Macao (one) Glenn McCartney, holidays associated with Chinese New Year will be important to “measure and evaluate the interest and game -related expenses, as well as regional visits, given the investment in events at the city's scale and the expected large number of visitors, ”he told HM. “From a business point of view, the fundamental question is how the number of visitors translates into actual expenses and the impact this brings to small and medium-sized businesses, such as restaurants, bars and shops, whether they are overnight visitors or of day-trippers returning to Hong Kong or Zhuhai on the same day.” Thus, “there are expectations that the occupancy rate of Macau hotels will be high, and there will be some visitors of a day who will return to be in Zhuhai,” he estimated. More than a million Since in the same year's same year, the territory received almost 1.4 million tourists during the 8 -day Chinese New Year, it is expected for the coming days “a high number of visitors”, “like this year The Chinese New Year begins on January 29, Macau may benefit from the increase in the number of tourists in the previous and later weekends. ” But Glenn McCartney also highlights other factors that can enhance tourism numbers, “since we have watched greater accessibility and ease of border passage as an important factor since reopening after Covid, for example, with the increase of visitors of Hong Kong through the bridge. ” Glenn Mccartney also argues that the resorts' promotional activities and street festivities can also attract tourists, with “an important feature of Chinese New Year activities being the 'feedback' component”, with “residents and visitors being able to give their opinion, allowing authorities to understand the impact of these Chinese New Year activities.” “This type of feedback can be a valuable source to improve various aspects of Chinese New Year's organization, operations and marketing in order to analyze current and potential visitors in the future. The use of networks can be part of the impact analysis assessment of Chinese New Year's promotions, ”he said. For these days Helena de Senna Fernandes, director of tourism services, said she expects a daily average of 185,000 visitors, of which only eight thousand should be international. The main attraction during this period in Macau will be the Lunar New Year's stop, held on January 31 and repeated on February 8.

item.title: Press | Sam Hou Fai highlights diversity and internationalization
item.description:
The message was left by the chief executive during the dinner offered to the media in Portuguese and English. Sam Hou Fai highlighted the connecting link established with the international community
The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, considered that the Portuguese and English Language Communication bodies play a link in connection with the international community. The message was left during the traditional dinner offered to the media. According to the Social Communication Office, Sam Hou Fai stated that “social communication in Portuguese and English is an important example of Macau's cultural diversity and internationalization”. The Government leader stated that he hopes that these bodies “will also continue to perform well as an international link, enhancing the advantages of linguistic, cultural and international ties, continuing to present to the outside world the uniqueness of Macau, resulting from the fusion of Eastern and Western cultures. ”. With this hope, the government leader believes that social communication agencies contribute to "raising the role of Macau as a platform between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, as well as a higher level opening platform." The chief executive also said he hoped that "the sector will continue to increase its development and to promote, along with the government, internationalization, so that Macao is more attractive and has a greater global influence." As such, Sam Hou Fai expects to transmit “abroad, through professional reports, the 'Macao Experiences' and the 'Wisdom of China', favoring better clarification and avoiding misunderstandings and bad interpretations of the foreigner, thus making the field in an important window of objective, rational and genuine exchange of oriental and western cultures ”. Protected freedoms In the hopes expressed at dinner with representatives of the media, Sam also asked for oversight of “government action”. In view of the year 2024, Sam Hou Fai made a positive assessment of the media's actions, indicating that “they played the important role of linking with the Portuguese and English communities abroad in accessing information about Macau”. Furthermore, he indicated that they “made good use of the unique advantages of the region, resulting from its proximity to Mainland China and its openness to the world” and made “the reality and development of Macau known and provided first-hand information to the public about the successful implementation of the one country, two systems principle.” The government leader also indicated that “freedom of the press is fully guaranteed by the Basic Law and the Macao SAR Press Law, which is why it will be safeguarded, as always and in accordance with the law, by the Macao SAR Government, which will support the sector in the correct fulfillment of its duties, in news coverage and access to news, actively collaborating in the efficient exchange of information between the various public services and the sector”.

item.title: Afghanistan | Beijing calls for severe punishment for authors of the murder of Chinese citizen
item.description: China yesterday appealed to the Afghan authorities to do an "exhaustive investigation" and "severely punish" those responsible for the murder on Wednesday of a Chinese citizen who worked on a gold mine in Takhar's Afghan province. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Mao Ning said yesterday at a press conference that Beijing is “deeply shocked” with the attack. "China is against all forms of terrorism," said the spokesman, appealing to the "repression of the Islamic State and other terrorist organizations listed by the UN Security Council." “China will continue to pay close attention to the security situation in Afghanistan and support the Afghan authorities in combating all forms of terrorist violence and maintaining security and stability in the country,” Mao added, urging the Afghan government to take necessary measures “to ensure the security of Chinese citizens and organizations in the country”. According to local police, the victim worked in a gold mine in the region, which borders Tajiquistan. A local branch of the Islamic State Islamic Group claimed the authorship of the attack. China is one of the few international actors that has maintained diplomatic relations with Afghanistan since the Taliban reached power in August 2021. The two countries share a small international border of just 76 kilometers in the easternmost part of the so-called Wajan Corridor, a remote pass in the Pamir mountain range. Chinese companies, with the support of Beijing, have sought to take advantage of opportunities to explore the vast deposits of non -developed resources from Afghanistan, especially Mes Aynak Mine, which is believed to contain the largest copper deposit in the world.

item.description: Mi Fu (1051-1107), the unique Song dynasty calligrapher, poet and painter who cultivated strangeness in his personal life to abstain from the contamination of worldly affairs, ancient or modern paintings that he observed, wrote that these “things do not they touch or stir me when I sit cross-legged like a monk, forgetting all my problems and putting myself in harmony with the vast, blue void» (Huashi), would in the future be the object of an immense admiration. In Dantu, one of the three districts of Zhenjiang (Jiangsu) where he lived for more than four decades, his memory is celebrated in a unique park in the country where you can see one thousand and three hundred copies of stone calligraphy engravings. Alluding to its source of inspiration, it was appropriately designed in front of the Hill of Ten Li, with aspects typical of landscape painting. The admirable novelty of his art was praised by Emperor Huizong (r.1100-1125), who knew him and who in his vertical scroll Pavilion of the Awakening of the Clouds (ink on silk, 150 x 78.8 cm, at the Smithonian) transcribed the phrase from Confucius that highlights what will be noticed in paintings called shanshui, «rivers and mountains» in continuous mutation: «Before the sky send the rains of the season, mountains and rivers presented the clouds.» In Mi Fu's paintings you can see this look at the changing fluid forms where the spirit could be revealed, unlike the drawings of animals or people that have stabilized forms (youdingxing). His legacy was also and above all cultivated by painters over time. Pan Simu (1756-1839), already in the last dynasty seven hundred years later, was one of those who used horizontal dots applied with precision by brush on paper, depicting successive receding mountains that characterized the Mi Fu method. Pan sim like Zhang Yin or Pan Gongshou, painters of the city of Zhenjiang, sought to establish a 'school' (father) based on the tradition of the city. In this memory inquiry, Pan sim realized his affinity with Mi Fu. It made it, for example, in two vertical rollers: the grou forest (helin) enevoid to rain (ink on paper, 128.9 x 31.4 cm, at the Minneapolis Art Institute); and in rain and fog in Helin (ink on paper, 109.9 x 31.8 cm, in the metmuseum). In the latter he refers to a visit to the temple where Mi Fu's tomb was located on the Yellow Crane Mountain (Huanghe shan) writing a poem in which the expression "old fool", laodian, is a characteristic manifestation of the affectionate, somewhat harsh familiarity with which he they treated the adherents of the Dao; «The great fame of the crane forest extends for years and years,/ I spent the night there once in the spring and there I made this painting remembering the old fool./ If the old fool returned now, he would laugh saying;/ Who dared coming to steal my meditation on Chan?”
